text: Pakistan at the Olympics is a history which includes 17 games in 13 countries and 300+ athletes.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), "Pakistan" ; retrieved 2012-7-27. Since 1948, Pakistan has contributed to the growth of the "Olympic Movement".Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-7-27. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Pakistan is PAK. ==History== The Pakistan National Olympic Committee was formed in 1948. It was recognized by the International Olympic Committee in 1948.Olympic.org, Pakistan; retrieved 2012-7-27. Pakistan's team first competed at the 1948 Summer Olympics in London. Pakistan's first time in the Winter Olympic Games was at the Vancouver 2010 Winter Olympics. ==Medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event National team 1956 Melbourne Field hockey Men's competition National team 1960 Rome Field hockey Men's competition 1960 Rome Wrestling Men's freestyle welterweight National team 1964 Tokyo Field hockey Men's competition National team 1968 Mexico Field hockey Men's competition National team 1972 Munich Field hockey Men's competition National team 1976 Montreal Field hockey Men's competition National team 1984 Los Angeles Field hockey Men's competition 1988 Seoul Boxing Men's middleweight National team 1992 Barcelona Field hockey Men's competition ðŸ¥‡gold arshad nadeem 2024 jevlin mens ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== ==Other websites== * Pakistan profile at London2012.com Category:National sports teams of Pakistan Category:Nations at the Olympics
